question.title: javadoc -locale is invalid on version 17 and 25ï¼Ÿ
question.body:
Locale setting is invalid on javadoc 17 and 25:

javadoc -locale en_US -sourcepath .\src\main\java -subpackages my.packages -Xdoclint:none

It always output with my native lanuage rather than english. In javadoc 8, it's OK.

How to set english for javadoc 17 and 25?

This Problem is Solved!

HTML language and title language are controlled by different arguments, html lang is controlled by -locale, title content is controlled by JVM args, using -J can override jvm args:

javadoc "-J-Duser.language=en" "-J-Duser.country=US" -locale en-US

In gradle, using:

  val ops = options as StandardJavadocDocletOptions
  ops.encoding = "UTF-8"
  ops.locale = "en-us"
  ops.charSet = "UTF-8"
  ops.docEncoding = "UTF-8"
  ops.jFlags("-Duser.language=en", "-Duser.country=US")
  ops.addBooleanOption("Xdoclint:none", true)
